subject: Philosophy
title: The Absurd
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Absurd usable.

hook.text: Humans crave meaning. The universe offers silence. Camus called the collision 'the absurd.'

buildup.text: The absurd isn't in us or in the world alone. It's in the gap between our expectations and reality.

discovery.text: Camus saw three responses: suicide, religious faith, or revolt. He chose revolt.

twist.text: Revolt means living fully despite the absurdity. No false comfort, no despair â€” just defiant joy.

climax.text: Camus wasn't depressed. He loved life precisely because it had no guaranteed purpose.

punchline.text: The absurd sets you free if you let it.

quiz.question: What did Camus recommend as a response to the absurd?
